name: navigably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a navigable manner (= deep, wide, or safe enough for a boat to go through): All of these rivers are navigably connected to the open sea. The canals were the most navigably efficient way to transport the materials.
More examplesFewer examplesThe new canal will navigably link the two lakes.The lagoon is connected to the ocean, but not navigably, because of the waterfall.The river is not navigably deep here.The waterways are navigably challenging for the ship's pilots.
